channel.title: Mandelbrot Set Viewer [Updated]
channel.description:
Yeah, I got bored again. This is as buggy as they come, because I kinda coded as I thought. Since I'm not really releasing it to important people (hah), I couldn't be bothered to make it nice or efficient.
Click and drag to zoom in, right click to zoom back to original.
Edit: Fixed a few bugs, and made it a little better. You can now select the area you want to zoom into (drag the mouse). You can also save & load states, as well as save the image & resize the frame (the bigger the frame, the longer the calculation). You can also change the calculation depth (the higher the depth, the more detail).
Screen shot of the newer version. [IMG]http://img201.imageshack.us/img201/6941/piccyin7.jpg[/img]
For the more observant users: Just using JCreator to do quick edits, I don't need an IDE lecture ;)

item.title: Mandelbrot Set Viewer [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:11, topic:135859”]I made one - but I I cheated I used the formula from a c++ Mandelbrot generator I found on the net and converted it to Java… not much cheating, since I bet you did the same (just for the formula, not the rest)

EDIT: C#*, and from http://www.codeproject.com/csharp/mandelbrot.asp[/quote]
No, the formula is actually very simple - there’s no need to copy it from another program. It’s just a basic geometric progression.
z(t + 1) = z(t)^2 + c

Read full topic

item.title: Mandelbrot Set Viewer [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:6, topic:135859”][quote author=Iamadam link=topic=187338.msg1693343#msg1693343 date=1187835245]

[quote author=1337h4x link=topic=187338.msg1693262#msg1693262 date=1187833400]
l2java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double
[/quote]Why?
The class I used is smaller, and took roughly 15 seconds to create.
[/quote]Not too many reasons Your class might be smaller, but Point2D will be in the jdk no matter what hence unneeded space. Also it’s good to be standard.

Still, the main reason is that I really wanted to say l2 :P[/quote]
The main reason I made my own class is because I couldn’t remember where Point2D was =P

Read full topic
